gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 630 (Kaby Lake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
title: Alan Wake

notes:
Game runs generally fine.  Framerate does stutter every now and again and the game likes to crash.  AA causes the grass to look blocky. Minor graphical glitches.

Pulse Audio crackling problem fix causes stuttering in the cutscene audio. Remove "tsched=0" from /etc/pulse/default.pa if this issue presents.  And then put it back when you're done playing.
title: Alan Wake

notes: Some graphical glitches, occasional framerate drop and performance a little worse than on Windows, but still playable (over 40fps most of the time with graphics maxed out).
title: Alan Wake

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.11-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Runs well in DX9 mode, but I didn't find out how to enable DirectX10 to run the game with DXVK
title: Alan Wake

notes: Game would run successfully without tweaks in Proton 3.7 but it stopped working in 3.16. Opened bug report https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/1815 to fix that. In the meanwhile, you can run it via launch options "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 %command%"
title: Alan Wake

notes: WINEPREFIX=/home/user/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/108710/pfx winetricks --force xact ,then open winecfg and override xaudio2 dll:s to native ,that seems to solve audio problems for me.  Some slowdowns and strutter ,here and there ,but perfectly playable. Can't max out tho.
title: Alan Wake

notes: WINEPREFIX=/home/user/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/108710/pfx winetricks --force xact ,then open winecfg and override xaudio2 dll:s to native ,that seems to solve audio problems for me. Some slowdowns and strutter ,here and there ,but perfectly playable. Can't max out tho.
